New Records: Nick Castellanos hit the Phillies' fifth career postseason walk-off hit
Key Match Events: Nick Castellanos hit a winning single in the 9th inning to score Trea Turner and send the Phillies to a 7-6 win over the Mets
Mark Vientos hit a pair of two-run homers for the Mets
Bryce Harper hit a two-run homer and Castellanos' solo drive in a three-pitch span from Luis Severino sparked the Phillies' comeback from a 3-0, sixth-inning deficit
Pre-Game Insights: Mets manager Carlos Mendoza said 'No excuses. It’s been hard, but here we are. I’m just looking forward to get back to Citi Field.'
Post-Match Reflections: Castellanos said 'When I'm old and no one cares about me as a baseball player anymore, we’re going to be home and be able to remember and look back at that.'
Bryce Harper said 'Just a great game. Never-die mentality.'
Miscellaneous Highlights: The series is now tied 1-1 as the Phillies and Mets head to Game 3 in New York
The game featured several dramatic swings, including Castellanos' walk-off hit and Harper's two-run homer
The attendance at Citizens Bank Park was 45,679
